text: Lost Horse Mine Lost Horse Mine is a historic gold and silver mine in the Lost Horse Valley of Joshua Tree National Park.Lost Horse Mine, Joshua Tree National Park, National Park Service, Lost Horse Mine Between 1894 and 1931, it produced 10,000 ounces of gold and 16,000 ounces of silver. It was first developed by Johnny Lang, then by J.D. Ryan. Scarce resources for steam powered pumps and mining equipment, led to denuding the local mountains of trees, which is still clearly visible in 2014. ==References== Category:Joshua Tree National Park Category:Gold mines in California Category:Mining in Riverside County, California Category:Buildings and structures in Riverside County, California
title: Lost Horse Mine
